column4: Anyone know of a program in the ubuntu repository that will allow creation of .pdf files from image files?
perhaps imagemagick's convert
perhaps gimp
gimp can create .pdf files?
I had no idea.
But technically it would rarely make any sense.
read again; I wrote "perhaps"
Or use OpenOffice Draw maybe.  I guess it will write pdf when the oowriter does.
gimp will save as ps
and from there ps2pdf in the terminal should do it
but ... why?
So I scanned some pages in a book, and I want to make them into a .pdf file.
Does that sound like a good reason to you?

I see.  Makes sense.  Then you should probably use OpenOffice Writer, import the images, resize them to fill the entire page, and then export to pdf.  Then you have a real pdf book.  I'm not aware of other tools for doing this.
Okay, I wasn't aware that OpenOffice had something.
This is a pain to do with windows, I'm glad it seems a lot easier with ubuntu. :)
Otherwise you'll just have 1000 pdf files instead of 1 pdf file with 1000 pages.
I don't know if it's easier, but it can be done =)
well with windows, all the programs usually aren't free, and the ones that are marketed as free are just trial editions
and they'll leave water marks on your .pdf
It's annoying.
don't ask about LaTeX .. don't got down that road.
I know a lot about LaTeX
